ai.summary: Dun Coillich White is a 6.4 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom, with the region listed as unknown. The route features grassy moorland, gentle ascents, and expansive hill views, making it suitable for hikers with moderate fitness seeking a half day outing.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain combines grassy paths with occasional rocky sections and uneven ground. Expect gentle to moderate ascents, open moorland, and potential boggy patches after rain. Navigation remains straightforward on well marked routes, but conditions can change rapidly.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in UK hill regions can change quickly; wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers with a waterproof jacket. Stay on marked trails and carry a map and compass or reliable navigation device. Bring enough water and snacks, a head covering, and a light extra layer. Check daylight hours and weather forecasts; tell someone your route; carry a charged phone and a whistle for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Emergency whistle and pack rain cover
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April to October) typically offers the best conditions for this hike, with longer days and drier trails. The route can be tackled year-round with appropriate gear and experience, though winter conditions may be challenging.
